description: Attaches a typed link to a specified source and target object. For more information, see Typed Links.

parameters.name: DirectoryArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the directory where you want to attach the typed link.

parameters.name: SourceObjectReference
parameters.description: Identifies the source object that the typed link will attach to. Selector (string) --- A path selector supports easy selection of an object by the parent/child links leading to it from the directory root. Use the link names from each parent/child link to construct the path. Path selectors start with a slash (/) and link names are separated by slashes. For more information about paths, see Access Objects. You can identify an object in one of the following ways: $ObjectIdentifier - An object identifier is an opaque string provided by Amazon Cloud Directory. When creating objects, the system will provide you with the identifier of the created object. An object's identifier is immutable and no two objects will ever share the same object identifier. To identify an object with ObjectIdentifier, the ObjectIdentifier must be wrapped in double quotes. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call.

nested_params.name: Selector
nested_params.description: A path selector supports easy selection of an object by the parent/child links leading to it from the directory root. Use the link names from each parent/child link to construct the path. Path selectors start with a slash (/) and link names are separated by slashes. For more information about paths, see Access Objects. You can identify an object in one of the following ways:

parameters.name: TargetObjectReference
parameters.description: Identifies the target object that the typed link will attach to. Selector (string) --- A path selector supports easy selection of an object by the parent/child links leading to it from the directory root. Use the link names from each parent/child link to construct the path. Path selectors start with a slash (/) and link names are separated by slashes. For more information about paths, see Access Objects. You can identify an object in one of the following ways: $ObjectIdentifier - An object identifier is an opaque string provided by Amazon Cloud Directory. When creating objects, the system will provide you with the identifier of the created object. An object's identifier is immutable and no two objects will ever share the same object identifier. To identify an object with ObjectIdentifier, the ObjectIdentifier must be wrapped in double quotes. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call.

For more information about paths, see Access Objects. You can identify an object in one of the following ways:

parameters.name: TypedLinkFacet
parameters.description: Identifies the typed link facet that is associated with the typed link. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the schema. For more information, see  arns. The unique name of the typed link facet.

nested_params.name: SchemaArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the schema. For more information, see  arns.

nested_params.name: TypedLinkName
nested_params.description: The unique name of the typed link facet.

parameters.name: Attributes
parameters.description: A set of attributes that are associated with the typed link. (dict) --- Identifies the attribute name and value for a typed link. The attribute name of the typed link. The value for the typed link. StringValue (string) --- A string data value. BinaryValue (bytes) --- A binary data value. BooleanValue (boolean) --- A Boolean data value. NumberValue (string) --- A number data value. DatetimeValue (datetime) --- A date and time value.

nested_params.name: AttributeName
nested_params.description: The attribute name of the typed link.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value for the typed link.

nested_items.name: TypedLinkSpecifier
nested_items.description: Returns a typed link specifier as output.

nested_items.name: TypedLinkFacet
nested_items.description: Identifies the typed link facet that is associated with the typed link.

nested_items.name: SchemaArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the schema. For more information, see  arns.

nested_items.name: TypedLinkName
nested_items.description: The unique name of the typed link facet.

nested_items.name: SourceObjectReference
nested_items.description: Identifies the source object that the typed link will attach to.

nested_items.name: Selector
nested_items.description: A path selector supports easy selection of an object by the parent/child links leading to it from the directory root. Use the link names from each parent/child link to construct the path. Path selectors start with a slash (/) and link names are separated by slashes. For more information about paths, see Access Objects. You can identify an object in one of the following ways:

$ObjectIdentifier - An object identifier is an opaque string provided by Amazon Cloud Directory. When creating objects, the system will provide you with the identifier of the created object. An object's identifier is immutable and no two objects will ever share the same object identifier. To identify an object with ObjectIdentifier, the ObjectIdentifier must be wrapped in double quotes.
/some/path - Identifies the object based on path.
#SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call.

nested_items.description: Identifies the target object that the typed link will attach to.

$ObjectIdentifier - An object identifier is an opaque string provided by Amazon Cloud Directory. When creating objects, the system will provide you with the identifier of the created object. An object's identifier is immutable and no two objects will ever share the same object identifier. To identify an object with ObjectIdentifier, the ObjectIdentifier must be wrapped in double quotes.
/some/path - Identifies the object based on path.
#SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call.
